benchmark_details.name: Understanding Pun with Image Explanations (UNPIE)
benchmark_details.overview: UNPIE is a novel benchmark designed to assess the impact of multimodal inputs in resolving lexical ambiguities, specifically using text-based puns paired with illustrative images. It includes three multimodal challenges: Pun Grounding, Pun Disambiguation, and Pun Reconstruction.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess machinesâ€™ capacity to actively integrate information from visual sources to resolve ambiguity in text, using puns as a testing ground.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset primarily models lexical ambiguities unique to English and may inadvertently perpetuate cultural biases present in the humor.

data.source: The data is derived from the SemEval 2017 English pun corpus, enhanced with visual annotations and multilingual translations.
data.annotation: The pun explanations were generated using a text-to-image model and curated by human annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on exact matches with the ground-truth outputs and semantic similarity using BERTScore.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates better performance in identifying puns and translating them accurately, while BERTScore correlates with human judgments on semantic alignment.
methodology.validation: Evaluations were conducted through a combination of machine-based and human assessments.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: UNPIE includes multilingual aspects aimed at diverse linguistic contexts, but specifics on demographic breakdowns are not provided.
